page.title: 03A View From The Trundle
page.content: From the triangulation point at the peak of the Trundle,the view ranges from eighteen to twenty-two miles.Looking in a north-westerly direction,St. Roche's Gate and Singleton Plantation are in clear view.Singleton is situated north of the Trundle,but only the roofs of the houses can be seen.Goodwood racecourse,although not in our allocated area,can be seen looking to the north-east.Westwards is the Seven Points Cottage,which is on the edge of Singleton Plantation.A main road,which leads to Singleton,surrounds the Trundle,and a junction with a car park is to the north-east of the hill.On a clear day,the view is extensive-the Isle of Wight,Portsmouth,Chichester and Chichester Police Station tower mast are all visible from the triangulation point.
